metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9983 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Directory Traversal exists in RAR 4.x and 5.x because an unpack operation follows any symlinks, including symlinks contained in the archive. This allows remote attackers to write to arbitrary files via a crafted archive.

notes.Note: sbeattie> PoC in debian bug report

criterions.comment: rar: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
